title-part.text: DESTRUCTIVE DISTILLATION OF CARBONAGEOUS MATERIALS FOR PRODUCTION OF GAS, COKE, TAR, OR SIMILAR MATERIALS

reference.text: cracking oils C10G; underground gasification of minerals E21B43/295

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: with horizontal and vertical heating flues
situated in the longitudinal direction of the chambers
situated in the longitudinal direction of the oven battery
Coke ovens with mechanical conveying means for the raw material inside the oven
Coke ovens with means for bringing and keeping the charge under mechanical pressure
Heating of coke ovens by electrical means
Heating of coke ovens with combustible gases
in coke ovens suitable for the use of lean gas or rich gas
by controlling or varying the openings between the heating flues and the regenerator flues
Methods of heating ovens of the chamber oven type
by introducing the heating gas and air at various levels
at the top and the bottom of the vertical heating flues
by introducing the heating gas and air at the top of the vertical flues only
Other methods of heating coke ovens
Doors or closures for coke ovens
Lids or closures for charging holes
Arrangements for withdrawal of the distillation gases
with outlets arranged at different levels in the chamber
during the charging operation of the oven
Controlling or preventing expansion or contraction
Preventing or repairing leakages of the brickwork
Bracing or foundation of the ovens
Devices for charging and discharging coke ovens

CPC-specific-text.text: Decoking tools, e.g. hydraulic coke removing tools with boring or cutting nozzles

title-part.text: Extracting coke with built-in devices, e.g. gears, screws
Mechanical treatments of coal charges in the oven
combined with agitating means, e.g. rotating tables or drums
Safety devices, e.g. signalling or controlling devices for use in the discharge of coke
for the withdrawal of the distillation gases
from conduits, valves or the like

CPC-specific-text.text: Devices for recovering spilled coke, e.g. recovering the coke falling out the oven when opening doors or withdrawing the leveler bar

title-part.text: Devices for producing compact unified coal charges outside the oven
Destructive distillation of solid carbonaceous materials with indirect heating, e.g. by external combustion
in coke ovens of the chamber type
in which the charge is subjected to mechanical pressures during coking
with the aid of hot liquids, e.g. molten salts
with indirect heating means both inside and outside the retorts
according to the moving bed type
with the aid of hot liquids, e.g. molten salts
in ovens with mechanical conveying means
Destructive distillation of solid carbonaceous materials by direct heating with heat-carrying agents including the partial combustion of the solid material to be treated
with hot gases or vapours, e.g. hot gases obtained by partial combustion of the charge
while moving the solid material to be treated
according to the moving bed type
by mixing tangentially, e.g. in vortex chambers
with hot liquids, e.g. molten metals
with moving solid heat-carriers in divided form
Destructive distillation of solid carbonaceous materials by combined direct and indirect heating
Destructive distillation, specially adapted for particular solid raw materials or solid raw materials in special form
of oil shale and/or or bituminous rocks
of synthetic polymeric materials, e.g. tyres

CPC-specific-text.text: waste in general, e.g. household waste C10B53/00;

reference.text: recovery or working-up of waste materials of organic macromolecular compounds or compositions based thereon by dry-heat treatment for obtaining partially depolymerised materials C08J11/10; production of liquid hydrocarbon mixtures from rubber or rubber waste C10G1/10

title-part.text: in the form of briquettes, lumps and the like
Coking mineral oils, bitumen, tar, and the like or mixtures thereof with solid carbonaceous material
Features of destructive distillation processes in general

CPC-specific-text.text: After-treatment of coke, e.g. calcination desulfurization
containing mineral oils, bitumen, tar or the like or mixtures thereof

title-part.text: Modifying the properties of the distillation gases in the oven
